title: BBC Local Live: York and North Yorkshire on Wednesday 17 August 2016 - BBC News
summary: news , sport , travel and weather updates will resume at 07:00 on thursday .
jack laugher wins silver in olym springboard final .
warning after suspected 'skimming ' device found on petrol pump .
north yorkshire uni students urged to get meningitis vaccine .

documents.title: five things we 've learnt about north yorkshire today
text: this is where we leave things for today - please join us again at 07:00 on thursday morning .
let 's round up five things we 've learnt about the county today
after perhaps a dollop of luck to qualify for the olympic 3m springboard final , ripon diver jack laugher said he felt `` no pressure '' and took his chance to bag a second medal .
if you 're off to uni next month , it would be wise to get a meningitis jab beforehand .
the 'poopinator ' has arrived at rowntree park .
york city 's second-half collapse against gateshead should act as a `` massive wake-up call '' , the side 's boss says .
thousands of racing fans are descending on york for the ebor festival , which gets going today .
i 'll leave you with this serene image of hay bales at ainderby steeple , sent in by bbc weather watcher emma 's dales .
author: Tom Airey
BBC Local Live, York

documents.title: double olympic medallist wakes up to busy inbox
text: british diver jack laugher has thanked his supporters after another successful session in the pool at rio 2016 .
the 21-year-old , who grew up in ripon and trains in leeds , took silver in the 3m springboard final on tuesday .
last week , he won gb 's first diving gold medal with his partner chris mears in the synchronised 3m springboard event .

documents.title: next step for tadcaster bridge repairs
text: work to repair tadcaster 's flood-hit bridge seems to be well under way now , according to north yorkshire county council 's latest tweet .
sections of the 300-year-old road bridge in tadcaster fell into the river wharfe on 29 december after devastating floods hit parts of north yorkshire .
arch formwork for # tadcaster bridge repair is taking shape on site .
a crane will eventually lift it into position

documents.title: listen : ripon diver jack laugher 's 'unbelievable olym
text: i 've just been speaking to ripon diver jack laugher about his `` unbelievable olym
jack won olympic silver in the men 's individual 3m springboard final on tuesday , six days after claiming synchronised gold .
the 21-year-old , who 's from ripon and who trains in leeds , tells me he 'll be taking home a `` fantastic amount of memories '' :
author: Jules Bellerby
Presenter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: york city drubbing 'a massive wake-up call ' - mcnamara
text: york city 's manager has apologised to fans after what he called an `` embarrassing '' 6-1 defeat at gateshead last night .
despite the first half of the national league tie finishing level , the minstermen conceded five goals in the second .
city boss jackie mcnamara said : `` it 's a massive wake-up call for us .
`` we 've not looked vulnerable defensively up until tonight , but i do n't think they coped physically with their front three and we made too many mistakes that were punished . ''
author: BBC Radio York Sport

documents.title: north yorkshire in spectacular sunset at winskill stones
text: thanks to neil brayshaw for sending us this spectacular of sunset over winskill stones near settle last night - with ingleborough just in view in the background .
we always love to feature the best you 've taken of north yorkshire .
why not email or tweet your photographs to us ?
author: Tom Airey
BBC Local Live, York

documents.title: ripon 's jack laugher 's 'monumental effort ' for diving silver
text: retired diver and olympic silver medallist leon taylor has applauded jack laugher 's rio silver diving medal win .
he said : `` it was a monumental effort by laugher .
he was all over the place in the preliminary round and semi-final .
but it does n't matter , he has come out and delivered . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: north yorkshire 's weather : dry with some sunshine this afternoon
text: some stubborn cloud still lingering in the east but throughout the afternoon this should start to thin revealing some good breaks .
further inland , we stand the best chance of seeing the sunshine and where we do it will feel warm .
so generally speaking this afternoon should be pleasant - warm and dry with a gentle to moderate south easterly breeze .
highs of about 21c ( 70f ) although some places could reach the mid 20s in the sun .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: students urged to get meningitis vaccine
text: north yorkshire teenagers heading to university next month are being urged to get vaccinated against meningitis before they go .
public health england says the jab will help protect against meningitis w in particular - a sometimes deadly strain that is on the rise .
officials say new students are at risk as they often mix closely with groups of unfamiliar people - some who may unknowingly carry the bug .

yorkshire gp dean eggitt says : `` if young people do n't have the vaccination against meningitis , the risk is that if their body was to ever encounter it as an infection their immune system would n't be educated and would n't be able to fight off the bug properly . ''

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our york newsroom this lunchtime include :
author: Sarah Urwin
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on north yorkshire 's roads
text: a few traffic trouble spots are currently being reported in north yorkshire :
there 's queuing traffic and heavier than usual traffic on the a64 york bypass northbound in york between grimston bar interchange and the towthorpe moor lane junction .
there 's also queuing traffic and heavier than usual traffic on the a165 northbound between plough inn roundabout in cayton and the a64 westborough junction in scarborough .
and finally there are delays on the a169 malton road in both directions in pickering between the haygate lane junction and the westlands junction .
in the roadworks area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: northern hill farming panel established
text: a new panel has been formed to highlight the views of hill farmers in northern england .
the northern hill farming panel aims to represent northern uplands farmers in discussions with government ministers .
farmers will be able to support the work of the panel and potentially become panel members after its first year of operation , the yorkshire dales national park authority says .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: 'no pressure , no nerves ' for laugher in diving final
text: speaking after taking rio 2016 olym ripon diver jack laugher said : `` there are so many nerves , pressure and weather conditions around these olym it 's really hard to get on the board and do it - and i showed that in the semi-final in the morning .
`` i had luck on my side and i was in that final - and that was when i could really let loose , there was no pressure , no nerves . ''
has jack inspired you to get into diving ?
find out how with our special guide .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ebor festival gets going at york racecourse
text: thousands of people are expected to descend on york racecourse today for one of the highlights of the racing calendar .
the ebor festival has opened , with the group one juddmonte international race expected to attract big crowds .
it looks like there could be a fair bit of cloud at the racecourse this morning , but temperatures could still reach 21c later .
the first day of the welcome to yorkshire ebor festival 2016 has dawned .
what does today hold ?
postponed getting chinned .
brave words hawkbill might give him a race
got ta love the ebor , there sat but the weather do n't look good hope the rain holds off
author: Tom Airey
BBC Local Live, York

documents.title: meet the poopinator : machine cleans up after geese
text: rowntree park has many wonderful activities : a playground , tennis courts and a skate park among them .
but the one we could all do without is the goose poo slide .
for years geese have roamed free in the park .
and as their numbers grew , so did the problem they left behind .
author: YorkMix

documents.title: lots of olympic love on show in ripon for jack laugher
text: i 'm out in ripon this morning , the home of diver jack laugher .
last night jack won olympic silver in the men 's individual 3m springboard final - just six days after claiming synchronised gold .
and his achievements are being well and truly celebrated in his home city where there 's loads of olympic love on show :
author: Gareth Barlow
Journalist, BBC Radio York

documents.title: dingley family 'really pleased ' with diver 's olympic debut
text: last night was n't only a good one for ripon olympic silver medal-winning diver jack laugher .
north yorkshire was was also represented at the 3m springboard final in rio by ireland 's oliver dingley .
dingley , from harrogate , was taking part in his first olympic games and finished eighth .
chris dingley , oliver 's father , said he was `` really pleased '' with his son 's performance and added it was `` good to see oliver hold his own '' .
author: Tom Airey
BBC Local Live, York

documents.title: cycle ride in memory of mp jo cox gets under way
text: the sister of jo cox , the west yorkshire mp who was killed in june , will be among the riders taking part in day one of the jo cox cycle ride which is now under way .
the participants plan to pedal 260 miles to london after leaving cleckheaton in west yorkshire , raising money for the charities the batley and spen labour mp supported .
the cycling initiative was devised by sarfraz mian , from north yorkshire equestrian company neue schule .
he says : `` the jo cox way is our tribute to her life , her beliefs and all the pockets of good work that go on up and down the uk , in our villages , towns and cities . ''

documents.title: unemployment rate drops in yorkshire
text: unemployment in yorkshire and the humber dropped by 7,000 between april and june , new figures show , with the number of jobless in the region now standing at 159,000 .
the office for national statistics says the uk unemployment total fell by 52,000 to 1.64 million between april and june .
the uk unemployment rate remains at 4.9 % .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: 'they 'll see all your bits and bobs ' - jack laugher on the dangers of diving
text: ripon diver jack laugher is celebrating after taking his second olym in the 3m springboard final , and it 's probably fair to say he 's wo n't have given much thought to his trunks since standing on the podium in rio .
before he travelled to brazil , though , laugher visited bbc radio york for a chat with breakfast presenter georgey spanswick in what could be described as wide-ranging discussions .
in ty fashion , georgey did n't shy away from the difficult questions and asked jack about the dangers of his `` skimpy sport '' - and just why his trunks are so tight .
replying with a bit of true yorkshire honesty , laugher replied : `` if they 're too big , there 's a massive chance they are going to come down - especially in a big competition '' , he said .
and then , of course , there are the underwater cameras to consider
find out more from jack right here :
author: BBC Radio York

documents.title: warning after suspected 'skimming ' device found on petrol pump
text: a suspected `` skimming '' device has been found on a self-service pump at a petrol station in york .
the device , which is designed to read bank card details without the knowledge of the cardholder , was found on monday by a motorist at the petrol station in clifton moor .
it had been attached to the machine using velcro and came away in his hands .
it has now been taken away by police for examination .
pc john armstrong says : `` the motorist in this case did exactly the right thing by remaining vigilant , acting on his sus and contacting the police .
`` i would urge people to always take extra care when using cash machines and self-service petrol pumps , to avoid falling victim to card skimming devices . ''

documents.title: ripon roars on laugher to olympic silver
text: about 100 people gathered at ripon rugby club last night to cheer on hometown diver jack laugher .
after taking gold last week , laugher won silver in the 3m springboard final .
his father , dave , who watched his son 's endeavours at home on tv , .
has told bbc radio york the diver will be `` approaching his peak for tokyo 2020 '' .
`` he 's got so much more to give , '' he added .
back in rio , jack 's mother and sister gave bbc look north their reaction :
author: BBC Look North, Yorkshire

documents.title: north yorkshire 's weather : a fine , dry and warm day ahead
text: a fine , dry and warm day with sunny spells breaking through early cloud by lunchtime in most areas .
it will feel slightly cooler along the coast with an onshore breeze .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : 'jumping jack ' seals olympic silver at rio
text: if you did n't stay up late to watch ripon diver jack laugher secure olympic silver in the 3m springboard final , you can catch up with his heroics below .
laugher 's silver was gb 's 50th medal at rio 2016 and third in the diving pool .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the top stories from our york newsroom so far this morning include :
author: Cara Thorpe
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: traffic and travel : roadworks spark delays on a19 and a61
text: a couple of updates from north yorkshire 's roads :
queuing traffic 's being reported on the a19 in both directions in easingwold between the york road junction and the sykes lane junction due to roadworks .
and there are also queues on the a61 westbound in thirsk between the newsham road junction and the ripon way junction in the roadworks area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: north yorkshire 's weather : a cloudy start , brighter later
text: it 'll be a rather cloudy start and we could see some early mist and fog but this should soon clear leaving some stubborn cloud lingering on the east coast .

this will slowly thin , so things should brighten up further inland and where we do see some sunshine it will feel warm so generally speaking today should be another pleasant day - warm and dry with a gentle to moderate south easterly breeze .
highs of about 21c ( 70f ) although some places could reach the mid 20s in the sun .
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: ripon to rio : jack laugher wins silver in springboard final
text: ripon 's jack laugher has taken olympic silver in the men 's individual 3m springboard final , six days after claiming synchronised gold .
the 21-year-old scored 523.85 points to finish behind china 's cao yuan , who ended on 547.60 .
it 's gb 's 50th medal at rio 2016 - and , of course , is a major addition to yorkshire 's very own medal haul .
author: Tom Airey
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: traffic and travel : north yorkshire 's road and rail
text: things are looking generally quiet on north yorkshire 's roads at the moment , but there are a couple of trouble spots .
queuing traffic and heavier than usual traffic 's being reported on the a171 scalby road northbound in scarborough between the a170 stepney road junction and the green junction .
and a lane 's closed on the a64 westbound in tadcaster between the a162 junction and the a659 junction , because of a broken down vehicle .

meanwhile , on the rails things mostly seems to be running smoothly at york railway station , just now , according to the live departure board - however , the 07:08 service to newcastle is currently running about 20 minutes late and the 06:52 to manchester airport is running about 37 minutes late .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning folks , i 'll be with you until 14:30 with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across north yorkshire .
a good place to start is harrogate diver jack laugher adding olympic silver to his growing medal collection - more on that shortly .
weather watcher old man george has shared this cracking shot of knaresborough , taken last night .
please do get in touch and send your
author: Tom Airey
BBC Local Live, York
